page.title: 06Farming
page.content: South of northing 00 much of the land is devoted to rough pasture and the Forestry Commission. There are generally few farms in the survey area, but numerous sheep can be seen, roaming freely on the upland pastures. The most important breed, numerically and economically, is the Welsh mountain sheep, which is well suited to the rough terrain of much of upland Wales. This breed is very old, being native to the mountains. No evidence of any other type of pastoral farming is present. Arable farming is absent from the survey area.
